cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the eastern Gulf, then turning northeast toward the Florida Panhandle and inland across the Southeast U.S.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border westward to the Mouth of the Pearl River (including Pascagoula area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Alabama/Florida border to the Mississippi/Alabama border (Tropical Storm Warning) and Alabama/Florida border eastward to Suwannee River FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast from Alabama through the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (peak 25–35 kt) possible late Tuesday night into Wednesday as outer bands brush the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible (<3 ft) mainly at high tide; significant surge impacts expected east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible, locally higher in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornado threat in outer rain bands.
